Please send all submissions to:
kamdar@exodusfellowship.com
Kamdar's Guide to
EQ Photography
I’ve often asked people to send me screenshots. And some of you don’t know how to do it, so hopefully this little guide will help you out!
To take a picture while in the game press the minus sign on the number pad. If you want to take a self portrait press the F9 key and cycle thru the views til you get to one of the choices that lets you swing the “camera” around, using the mouse. I find its easier if I am facing a wall or a tree, then I can get as close a shot as I want. Then before you press the minus key to take the shot, hit the F10 button until you get a view that is uncluttered with text and all that other crap. If you want, you can even get rid of the floating name over your head, by checking that option off, in your display options.

Have fun and experiment! With practice you can take great action and nicely composed scenic shots. And you don't ever have to worry about running out of film! Just be careful you don't get killed in those dangerous situations!

To view the pictures you’ve taken, you will have to look them up in the EQ directory. Use My Computer or Windows Explorer to find the directory. The default location is C:/Program Files/EverQuest. Click on the Everquest directory and you can see all of the shots you have taken listed as bitmaps. They will look something like this…EQ000001. Click on the file to view it!

To send shots over email you have to “attach” them, and your email program should be able to explain how to do this. Some email programs don’t let you attach very large or very many files. I believe Yahoo Mail allows you to send a maximum of three files. The total combined attachments may not exceed 1.5 megabytes. You can also adjust the size of a file you want to send by opening the shot up in a picture editing program like PhotoImpact, Photosuite, Photo Deluxe, Photoshop, etc. They often have a “web” feature to help you get pictures down to a manageable size to send over the internet. If you are really handy with these types of programs you can even change the picture type from a bitmap to a jpeg which will also take up less space.

That’s about it! So send in those shots gang!
For self portraits face a wall, tree, post or rock
Press F9 til you get the view where you can swing the camera around
Press F 10 to remove all the clutter!
Have fun...Experiment and good luck!
...Closer is always better!
